definition: shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: Then she began to angrily hallo me.
sentences.chinese: 然後她開始向我憤怒地大喊大叫起來。

sentences.english: You might have to guess, based on whether they seem to be yelling at the same kids.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你得根據他們是否衝着同一個孩子大喊大叫來猜。

sentences.english: He never yelled at us for playing in his yard .
sentences.chinese: 我們在他的院子裏玩耍，他也從不對我們大喊大叫。

sentences.english: Junho yelled at Jay and Junsu ignored Jay when he tried to explain.
sentences.chinese: 俊昊對宰範大喊大叫而且峻秀無視宰範的解釋。

sentences.english: Astride the merry-go-round, the baby yelled with rapture.
sentences.chinese: 孩子騎在旋轉木馬上，興奮地大喊大叫。

sentences.english: She yells at me every time I make a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 每次我犯了錯她都要對我大喊大叫。

sentences.english: He started yelling in the supermarket.
When the tourist suddenly lost his temper, Wang became upset for being yelled at.
sentences.chinese: 當遊客突然大發脾氣，大喊大叫時，王琳感到很沮喪。

sentences.english: Maybe he won’t yell at me if I smell like a flower.
sentences.chinese: 也許我聞起來像鮮花一樣，他就不會朝我大喊大叫了。

sentences.english: He was slapped for his shouting.
sentences.chinese: 他因大喊大叫而受到斥責。

sentences.english: She screamed at and scolded everyone around her.
sentences.chinese: 她經常對她身邊的人大喊大叫和責罵。

sentences.english: When you want to scream and yell, instead ITCH.
sentences.chinese: 當你想要大喊大叫的時候，用渴望來替代。

sentences.english: He squawked he was badly treated.
sentences.chinese: 他大喊大叫着說他受到了虐待。

sentences.english: Los jóvenes se gritos en los conciertos de rock.
sentences.chinese: 那些年輕人在搖滾音樂會上大喊大叫。

sentences.english: Use of upper-case words is the equivalent of shouting in some one's ear.
sentences.chinese: 大寫字母相當於對準別人的耳朵大喊大叫。

definition: to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
